alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Franklin; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 5:14PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN ROANOKE...SOUTHWESTERN BEDFORD AND NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF ROANOKE THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 513 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Roanoke Mountain, or near Roanoke, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Roanoke... Vinton... Rocky Mount... Boones Mill... Moneta... Burnt Chimney... and Northwest Smith Mountain Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
